Ship Performance Analysis







## Load Data



::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
# Read the ship performance dataset
data <- read_csv("Take-home_Ex01/data/Ship_Performance_Dataset.csv")

# Display structure of the dataset
str(data)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
spc_tbl_ [2,736 Ã— 18] (S3: spec_tbl_df/tbl_df/tbl/data.frame)
```

## Data Cleaning



::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
# Check for missing values
colSums(is.na(data))
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
                   Date               Ship_Type              Route_Type 
                      0                       0                       0 
            Engine_Type      Maintenance_Status Speed_Over_Ground_knots 
                      0                       0                       0

                      0                       0                       0

                      0                       0                       0 
 Revenue_per_Voyage_USD   Turnaround_Time_hours   Efficiency_nm_per_kWh 
                      0                       0                       0 
  Seasonal_Impact_Score     Weekly_Voyage_Count Average_Load_Percentage 
                      0                       0                       0 
```


:::

```{.r .cell-code}
# Remove rows with missing critical values (assuming speed, fuel, efficiency are key factors)
#data <- data %>% drop_na(speed, fuel_consumption, efficiency)
```
:::



## Exploratory Data Analysis



::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
# Summary statistics for key metrics
summary(data[, c("Speed_Over_Ground_knots", "Efficiency_nm_per_kWh", "Engine_Power_kW")])
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
 Speed_Over_Ground_knots Efficiency_nm_per_kWh Engine_Power_kW
 Min.   :10.01           Min.   :0.1002        Min.   : 501   
 1st Qu.:13.93           1st Qu.:0.4636        1st Qu.:1148   
 Median :17.71           Median :0.7899        Median :1757   
 Mean   :17.60           Mean   :0.7987        Mean   :1758   
 3rd Qu.:21.28           3rd Qu.:1.1474        3rd Qu.:2383   
 Max.   :25.00           Max.   :1.4993        Max.   :2999   
```


:::
:::



## Distribution of Ship Speeds



::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
ggplot(data, aes(x = Speed_Over_Ground_knots)) +
  geom_histogram(fill = "#69b3a2", color = "black", bins = 20, alpha = 0.7) +
  labs(title = "Distribution of Ship Speeds",
       x = "Speed (knots)",
       y = "Count") +
  theme_custom
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Take-home_Ex01_files/figure-html/speed-distribution-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::



## Fuel Consumption vs Speed



::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
ggplot(data, aes(x = Speed_Over_Ground_knots, y = Engine_Power_kW)) +
  geom_point(alpha = 0.5, color = "#0073C2") +
  geom_smooth(method = "lm", se = FALSE, color = "red", linetype = "dashed") +
  labs(title = "Engine Power vs. Speed",
       x = "Speed (knots)",
       y = "Engine Power (kW)") +
  theme_custom
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Take-home_Ex01_files/figure-html/fuel-vs-speed-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::



## Efficiency Analysis



::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
ggplot(data, aes(x = factor(0), y = Efficiency_nm_per_kWh)) +
  geom_boxplot(fill = "#ffcc00", alpha = 0.7) +
  labs(title = "Ship Efficiency Boxplot",
       x = "",
       y = "Efficiency (nm/kWh)") +
  theme_custom
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Take-home_Ex01_files/figure-html/efficiency-boxplot-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::



## Conclusion



::: {.cell}
::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```

### Key Findings
```


:::

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
1. Most ships operate within a speed range of 10-25 knots, with minor variations.
```


:::

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
2. Engine power increases with speed, but the relationship is not perfectly linear.
```


:::

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
3. Efficiency (nautical miles per kWh) varies significantly among ships, indicating potential for optimization.
```


:::
:::
